comment: * @hide * A {@link Preference} that displays a list of entries as * a dialog which allow the user to toggle each individually on and off. * * @attr ref android.R.styleable#ListPreference_entries * @attr ref android.R.styleable#ListPreference_entryValues * * @deprecated Use the AndroidX * * Preference Library for consistent behavior across all devices. For more information on * using the AndroidX Preference Library see * Settings.

methods.name: public void setEntries(CharSequence[] entries)
methods.comment:
* Sets the human-readable entries to be shown in the list. This will be * shown in subsequent dialogs. *

* Each entry must have a corresponding index in * {@link #setEntryValues(CharSequence[])}. * * @param entries The entries. * @see #setEntryValues(CharSequence[])

methods.name: public void setEntries(@ArrayRes int entriesResId)
methods.comment:
* @see #setEntries(CharSequence[])
     * @param entriesResId The entries array as a resource.

methods.name: public CharSequence[] getEntries()
methods.comment:
* The list of entries to be shown in the list in subsequent dialogs.
     * 
     * @return The list as an array.

methods.name: public void setEntryValues(String[] entryValues)
methods.comment:
* The array to find the value to save for a preference when an entry from
     * entries is selected. If a user clicks on the second item in entries, the
     * second item in this array will be saved to the preference.
     * 
     * @param entryValues The array to be used as values to save for the preference.

methods.name: public void setEntryValues(@ArrayRes int entryValuesResId)
methods.comment:
* @see #setEntryValues(CharSequence[])
     * @param entryValuesResId The entry values array as a resource.

methods.name: public String[] getEntryValues()
methods.comment:
* Returns the array of values to be saved for the preference.
     * 
     * @return The array of values.

methods.name: public boolean getValue(int index)
methods.comment: * Get the boolean state of a given value.

methods.name: public void setValue(int index, boolean state)
methods.comment: * Set the boolean state of a given value.

methods.name: public CharSequence getSummary()
methods.comment:
* Returns the summary of this ListPreference. If the summary
     * has a {@linkplain java.lang.String#format String formatting}
     * marker in it (i.e. "%s" or "%1$s"), then the current entry
     * value will be substituted in its place.
     *
     * @return the summary with appropriate string substitution

methods.name: public void setSummary(CharSequence summary)
methods.comment:
* Sets the summary for this Preference with a CharSequence.
     * If the summary has a
     * {@linkplain java.lang.String#format String formatting}
     * marker in it (i.e. "%s" or "%1$s"), then the current entry
     * value will be substituted in its place when it's retrieved.
     *
     * @param summary The summary for the preference.

methods.name: public int findIndexOfValue(String value)
methods.comment:
* Returns the index of the given value (in the entry values array).
     * 
     * @param value The value whose index should be returned.
     * @return The index of the value, or -1 if not found.

methods.name: protected Object onGetDefaultValue(TypedArray a, int index)
protected void onSetInitialValue(boolean restoreValue, Object defaultValue)

methodNames: public void setValue(int index, boolean state)
protected Object onGetDefaultValue(TypedArray a, int index)
protected void onSetInitialValue(boolean restoreValue, Object defaultValue)
